user_query: a tee this role is to Pete Davidson what Emmett is to Chris Pratt you're a cloned cat sitting in a flying mechanical bug they don't make a car seat for that getting back to my favorite Lil Petey yet again DreamWorks has nailed having child characters that have that wholesome heartwarming personality but still have super devastating existential lines I know that's become kind of a cliche now you got this with Wyldstyle in The Lego Movie 2 Lumalee in the Mario movie but they do a fantastic job making it just feel part of Lil Petey's personality and the environment he has come into and not obvious Facebook mom Millennial bait the child voice actor killed it I can tell he went for a right on the spot no re-records energy stepping into that recording booth no but it sounds fun I want to be miserable too Dog Man as a character is also great voice-wise he gets so much emotion and personality just through the way the voice actor also known as Peter Hastings the director did the barks and howls and all that jazz it didn't ever get annoying or disconnected me from the character I've seen quite a few takes that Petey overshadows him and that it's because you can't do much with a non-talking character but I didn't feel that I think there's a good equal performance happening and like I stated both of their arcs and character growths Collide into each other to form the last act I think the film balanced them as well as it could Sarah Hatoff is also another highlight of the film as she
